channel.title: A pair of ideas
channel.description:
Ok, these have not been done on ANY server, i know this for a fact. I came up with the idea when i ran 'HastePK'. My server only lasted a month, but w/e, this is beside the point.
Idea 1: Boots under armoured skirts. How to do so? Take a robe, rename, change the mask colour, and give it the same stats as the current armoured skirt. Now, you can have armoured skirts and be able to wear boots underneath. Funky, no?
Idea 2: Dual wielding. What you would do, is replace the properties of a sword/axe/mace, so it has the same as what a shield would have. This would give you the ability to wield it in the off hand. Dual wield would remove the armour bonus of a shield, and replace it with +aim or +power, depending on sword, axe, or mace. My idea for stats would follow something like this: - Sword would have +aim, but -power - Mace, a slight +aim, slight +power - Axe, -aim but +power
I'm curious to know if this (the second idea) would work. I'm 85% sure it would, and i'm proposing the idea to you guys, as you have the skills required to make this come about. All i would ask, if someone does do this, is a credit for the idea. I'm only a designer with barely any coding knowledge, but i'm full of ideas and have been playing since 2001.
feedback?
ALSO: can we get a general discussion in the rsc forums? It gets so lonely down here.

item.title: A pair of ideas
item.dc:creator: @xT-e xT-e
item.description:
@xT-e wrote:

Well, I can just re-create a new object, from scratch and use that.
Make a sprite for the off hand but looking like a weapon.
It’s possible.
I was just curious as to what the other people here thought.

Read full topic

item.title: A pair of ideas
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

Adding duel weapons no matter what you do will be doing a sloppy job, due to the fighting sprites not being set for both hands. (or the other hand) except shield.

Read full topic

item.title: A pair of ideas
item.dc:creator: @oldskewl oldskewl
item.description:
@oldskewl wrote:

On my server you can wear boots with plated skirt,when you put on the boots it removes your character appearance legs, the plated skirt goes over it you cant even tell your legs are gone,sloppy but it works. As for dual wielding i have tried giving another weapon or shield stats(no problem) then changing the picture mask(appearance in inv) and wield position(what it replaces when equip) which works fine it looks like im wielding two dragon longs ( as thats the mask i used) the problem is when rotating my camera around the sprite image floats to the side looking unprofessional and out of place etc ,i cant even begin to figure out how to make new wield positions ive only been able to remove a body part to allow something new to be equip, i mean it “works” but defiantly done gimp, i guess if you can do your own sprites you could make something for offhand, maybe not even dual wield but a “charm” or some shit

Read full topic

item.title: A pair of ideas
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

Dual wield is an interesting idea… but it’ll probably end up as only moving one axe.

About the boots… limiting boots to females isn’t a great idea. In general, I’d rather not wear a skirt (at least in public). Add the boots on top of legs/below the skirt, it’ll require a few rewrites but shouldn’t be hard.

Read full topic

I meant on how previous posters said we could make Rune/drag/bronze/iron Boots.

-Kozy

Read full topic

item.title: A pair of ideas
item.dc:creator: @xT-e xT-e
item.description:
@xT-e wrote:

pesterd:

K so explain how to make the boots

Take a robe bottom for example, because with robes you can wear boots, right.
Change the mask colour of the robe bottom, to that of say, a rune skirt.
You then change the armour properties this skirt has, to be the same as a rune skirt.
Now, you have a rune skirt that you can wear boots under.

[quote=“Kozy, post:14, topic:271506”]Meh, the boots could be made… but it’s Pointless. Boots are some rs2 thing I’d suppose, it would take away the feel of RSC, and it would make Skirts waaay more overpowered than Legs, sou you would have to remove some of the bonuses on skirts.

-Kozy[/quote]

So, desert boots, normal boots, gnome boots, they all didn’t exist in classic? It’s not pointless. It adds another thing into what you can wear in a ‘suit’ or whatever you want to call it.
and obviously, on skirts you’d drop the armour bonus down a bit.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: A pair of ideas
item.dc:creator: @xT-e xT-e
item.description:
@xT-e wrote:

Look, obviously, each to their own.
If anyone wants to do the dual wielding idea, i have it fully layed out, if anyone wants to know the full extent of the idea.

Kozy, boots add armour, regardless what they are, and this can be used for staking.
All kinds of boots can be made so it wouldn’t be pointless at all.
Armoured legs would just get ruled out though.

Read full topic
